text: Spirit Tracks was an unneccessary re-tread, in my opinon. Phantom Hourglass was a very cool game that utilises the stylus perfectly. It also had amazing charm and atmosphere, although not quite as great as Wind Waker in that regard. It's not a 2D Zelda game though, it's basically its own style of the series.

author: Masamune Okami

text:
Atmosphere of OoT, with more puzzles like the 3D games, but a 2D game stylized like LttP, with optional up to 4 players, tons of dungeons(not just the usual 4-8, talking 10-16), tons of items(like LttP or the N64 games), and a massive world to explore, and an epic story(like LttP, OoT, or Skyward Sword)
This would make for hands down the greatest Zelda.

text: Probably one of the most known village theme in a video game. The version in Ocarina of Time is just as peaceful. I really miss playing new 2D Zelda games, especially since the DS iterations left such a bad taste in my mouth. I'd pay a lot of money to play a brand new 2D Zelda game with HD graphics that look as amazing as games like the upcoming Rayman Legends for the Wii U.
author: SupraDarky
